title: Professional Cost Estimation & Budget Planning | 5D BIM Services | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: What information do you need to provide an estimate?


A: Ideally, a BIM model (IFC or Revit file). If unavailable, we work with 2D drawings + specifications (timelines may extend 2-3 days).




Q: How accurate are your estimates?


A: Our 5D BIM estimates achieve Â±5% accuracy (when model is accurate and complete) vs Â±15-20% traditional methods. Backed by 20 years experience and 2000+ projects.




Q: Do you work with projects already in construction?


A: Yes! We provide ongoing cost control including weekly reports, change order analysis, and budget tracking.




Q: Can you integrate with our existing software?


A: Yes, we export to Excel, MS Project, Primavera P6, and most cost management platforms.




Q: What project sizes do you handle?


A: It depends on the industry. For warehouses and logistics centers, we handle projects from 5,000 sqm to 100,000+ sqm. For residential and commercial projects, our expertise ranges from small developments to large-scale mixed-use complexes. Each project type has different complexity factors beyond just size.




Q: How do your fees compare?


A: We provide bespoke quotes tailored to each projectâ€™s specific requirements, complexity, and scope. Contact us for a customized proposal that meets your needs.




Q: Do you provide estimates for tendering?


A: Absolutely. We offer full tendering support including: quantity take-off, detailed cost estimation, bid document preparation, contractor negotiations, and handover support. Our comprehensive service covers the entire tendering lifecycle.

title: BIM Takeoff | Professional QS & Cost Estimation Services
text:
Why Us?


Precision Built on Experience
2,000+ Projects Across Three Continents
Two decades of hands-on quantity surveying means we understand what matters. Our expertise spans drylining systems, structural works (FRP, suspended slabs, columns, post-tension), fire protection, and facade compliance - the high-value packages where accuracy is critical. We catch the details that generic QS firms miss, giving you reliable data for confident decision-making.


Fast Turnaround Without Compromise
Days, Not Weeks
Modern construction moves fast, and so do we. We extract quantities from 2D drawings, 3D models, or federated BIM environments, delivering formatted outputs ready for your estimating software. Typical turnaround: 2-7 days, without sacrificing accuracy when tender deadlines are tight.


Smart Budgeting That Protects Margins
Value Engineering Recommendations
Accurate estimation prevents costly overruns and material wastage. Our value engineering analysis identifies savings without compromising quality or compliance. Whether tendering competitively or planning developments, our estimates help you price profitably and avoid financial surprises.


Audit-Ready Deliverables
Structured for Your Workflow
Receive detailed breakdowns of quantities, materials, and costs formatted for your specific process. Our reports are clear, traceable, and ready to integrate into your workflow. Every takeoff includes quality assurance checks for added confidence.


Specialist Trade Knowledge
Not Just General QS - True Expertise
Our team brings hands-on trade expertise in complex construction packages. We specialize in drylining systems, fire protection, facade compliance, and structural works including FRP, suspended slabs, columns, and post-tension systems. Staying current with BSR/HRB regulations post-Grenfell. International standards meets modern BIM capability.


Building Safety Act Compliance
Post-Grenfell Expertise
New regulations demand rigorous compliance budgeting. We specialize in fire safety systems, facade remediation, and Building Safety Regulator requirements. Accurate planning for High Risk Buildings helps you avoid regulatory cost surprises that can exceed budgets by 50-100%.

Q: Do you work with international pricing databases and standards?


A: Yes, we work with local pricing databases across UK, EU, and Australia. We adapt to your marketâ€™s standards including RICS NRM, BCIS, and regional cost data to ensure accurate estimates.




Q: How do you handle fast-track design changes?


A: Real-time updates. When changes occur in your BIM model, we can update costs within 24 hours.




Q: Do you offer ongoing cost control during construction?


A: Absolutely. We provide weekly or monthly cost reports, comparing actual vs.Â estimated costs with early warning systems for overruns.




Q: What file formats do you accept?

section: Why Traditional Take-offs Cost You Time & Money
text:
Why Traditional Take-offs Cost You Time & Money


Manual Take-off Problems
Traditional measurement methods are slow, error-prone, and expensive:


 4-6 weeks for complex projects


 Human error in measurements (5-15%)


 Missed quantities and elements


 Inconsistent measurement standards


 Design changes require complete re-measurement


 Difficult to verify and audit



The Cost of Errors

â€œOn a Â£10M project, even a 5% quantity error can result in Â£500,000 in unexpected costs or contractor claims. Manual take-offs simply cannot deliver the precision modern construction demands.â€




Our Automated Solution
Advanced AI-powered extraction with multi-level validation:


 2-3 days for complete take-off


 99.5% accuracy with triple validation


 Complete element capture (no missed items)


 ISO 19650 compliant measurement


 Instant updates for design changes


 Full audit trail and documentation

title: Automated Quantity Take-off | Multi-Level Validation | BIM Takeoff
section: Our Triple Validation System: Unmatched Accuracy
text:
Our Triple Validation System: Unmatched Accuracy

Why Three Validation Levels?
Construction projects cannot afford measurement errors. Our proprietary triple validation system ensures every quantity is verified through multiple independent processes, catching errors that single-validation systems miss.


Level 1: AI Extraction
Automated BIM Analysis
Our AI algorithms automatically extract quantities from your BIM model:

Pattern recognition for element identification
Automated measurement calculations
Clash detection and resolution
Duplicate element removal
Version control tracking

Accuracy: 98%
Duration: 1-2 hours


Level 2: Expert Review
Human Verification
Experienced Quantity Surveyors manually review AI outputs:

Cross-check against 2D drawings
Validate measurement methodologies
Identify missing elements
Apply construction knowledge
Verify unit conversions

Accuracy: 99.2%
Duration: 4-8 hours


Level 3: Cross-Reference
Independent Verification
Final validation against multiple sources:

Compare with historical project data
Benchmark against industry standards
Verify with specification documents
Check material relationships
Final QA sign-off

Final Accuracy: 99.5%+
Duration: 2-4 hours



Result: Each quantity is verified three times by independent systems, ensuring you receive the most accurate Bill of Quantities in the industry.

title: Automated Quantity Take-off | Multi-Level Validation | BIM Takeoff
text:
Our Proven 4-Step Process


Step 1: Model Ingestion & Preparation
Duration: 4-6 hours
What We Do:

Receive BIM model (IFC, Revit, ArchiCAD, Tekla)
Validate model completeness and integrity
Check element classifications and properties
Identify any data gaps or inconsistencies
Configure measurement parameters

What You Receive: Model validation report with any issues flagged


Step 2: Automated Extraction (Validation Level 1)
Duration: 1-2 hours (automated)
What We Do:

AI-powered quantity extraction from BIM model
Automated measurement calculations
Element classification and grouping
Clash detection and duplicate removal
Generate preliminary Bill of Quantities

What You Receive: Preliminary BOQ with automated measurements


Step 3: Expert Review (Validation Level 2)
Duration: 4-8 hours
What We Do:

Quantity Surveyor manual verification
Cross-check with 2D drawings
Apply construction industry standards
Identify and add missing elements
Validate measurement methodologies
Apply project-specific requirements

What You Receive: Expert-reviewed BOQ with quality assurance notes


Step 4: Cross-Reference & Final QA (Validation Level 3)
Duration: 2-4 hours
What We Do:

Compare with historical project data
Benchmark against industry standards
Final specification document verification
Senior QS sign-off
Generate comprehensive documentation
Prepare audit trail and commentary

What You Receive: Final validated BOQ with complete documentation and audit trail



Total Timeline: 12-20 working hours
Total Project Duration: 2-3 days from model receipt to final delivery

title: Automated Quantity Take-off | Multi-Level Validation | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: What if my project doesnâ€™t have a BIM model?


A: We can work with 2D drawings (DWG, PDF) but timelines will be significantly longer as weâ€™ll need to extract quantities manually. For best results and fastest turnaround, we recommend using BIM models or consider our BIM modeling services to convert your 2D drawings first.




Q: How accurate is your triple validation system?


A: Our triple validation system achieves 99.5%+ accuracy when the source BIM model is complete and accurate. Each quantity is independently verified three times (AI extraction, expert review, cross-reference), ensuring the highest level of precision in the industry. We provide complete audit trails for all measurements.




Q: What happens if the design changes during the project?


A: Thatâ€™s the beauty of BIM-based take-offs! We can quickly update quantities based on the revised model - typically within 4-8 hours rather than weeks for manual re-measurement. We offer ongoing update services at discounted rates for active projects.




Q: Do you comply with international measurement standards?


A: Yes, we comply with RICS New Rules of Measurement (NRM), ISO 19650 BIM standards, and can adapt to local standards including Polish KNR, Australian AIQS, or any other regional requirements. Our Quantity Surveyors are experienced with international projects.




Q: Can you handle large, complex projects?


A: Absolutely. Weâ€™ve successfully completed take-offs for projects ranging from small renovations to 100,000+ sqm developments. Our AI-powered system actually performs better on larger projects where manual take-offs would be prohibitively time-consuming. Complex projects may require 3-4 days instead of 2-3.




Q: What level of detail (LOD) do you need in the BIM model?


A: We can work with LOD 300 and above for most projects. LOD 350-400 is ideal for detailed trade-specific take-offs. If your model is at LOD 200, we can still extract useful quantities but may need to supplement with 2D drawings for detailed measurements.




Q: Do you provide take-offs for specific trades or disciplines?


A: Yes! We can extract quantities for any trade: structural (concrete, steel, masonry), architectural (finishes, doors, windows), MEP (mechanical, electrical, plumbing, fire protection), civil works, and specialized systems. We tailor the BOQ format to match your trade requirements.




Q: How do you handle model inconsistencies or errors?


A: This is exactly why we use triple validation. Our Level 1 AI identifies clashes and duplicates automatically. Level 2 expert review catches model errors and cross-checks with 2D drawings. Level 3 verification ensures logical consistency. We document all assumptions and flag any areas of concern for your review.




Q: Whatâ€™s your pricing structure?


A: Each project is assessed individually based on project size, complexity, level of detail required, and specific deliverables. Contact us with your project details for an accurate quote within 24 hours.

title: Specialist Trade Estimating: Drylining, Fire Protection, Facades, Structural | BIM Takeoff
section: Why Specialist Trades Need Specialist Estimators
text:
Why Specialist Trades Need Specialist Estimators


The Problem
Generic estimators miss the complexity that specialist trades demand:


 Drylining: Missing acoustic/fire rating multipliers, incorrect stud sizing


 Fire Protection: Failing to account for certification costs, testing requirements


 Facades: Overlooking installation sequences, weatherproofing complexity


 Structural: Underestimating reinforcement, connection details, tolerances



Hidden Costs Add Up

â€œIn specialist trades, what you donâ€™t see in the estimate costs you during construction. Fire testing alone can represent 3-5% of total package value.â€




Our Solution
Specialists whoâ€™ve worked IN the trades, not just estimated FOR them:


 Hands-on experience installing drylining, fire systems, facades


 2,000+ specialist packages estimated across 3 continents


 Know the hidden costs: labor inefficiencies, material waste, rework risks


 Understand compliance: fire ratings, structural calculations, wind load testing


 Real-world estimating: not just BOQâ€”actual buildable costs

title: Specialist Trade Estimating: Drylining, Fire Protection, Facades, Structural | BIM Takeoff
text:
4 Specialist Areas of Expertise


Drylining & Partitions

What We Cover

Metal stud framing systems (Knauf, Gyproc, Siniat)
Plasterboard installation (standard, fire-rated, acoustic, moisture-resistant)
Suspended ceilings (exposed grid, concealed, acoustic panels)
Acoustic treatments and STC/Rw ratings
Fire-rated partitions and compartmentation



Our Experience

200+ drylining projects estimated (offices, warehouses, residential)
Worked with Knauf, British Gypsum, CSR Gyprock specifications
Understand labor rates: crew sizing, productivity factors, site access constraints
Know material waste factors: 8-15% depending on ceiling heights and cutting requirements



Typical Package Scope

Full BOQ with material specifications
Labor hours by system type (fire-rated = 1.3x standard productivity)
Equipment/scaffolding requirements
Testing and certification costs (fire ratings, acoustic performance)
Warranty and defects liability



Critical Knowledge


Acoustic sealant: often missed, adds 3-5% to material cost
Fire-rated systems: labor productivity drops by 30-50%
Height work: above 3.5m = 20% productivity decrease
Curved walls: material waste increases to 20-25%


Deliverable: Detailed estimate with installation sequence, material schedule, labor allocation



Fire Protection Systems

What We Cover

Passive fire protection (compartmentation, fire stopping, intumescent coatings)
Active fire systems (sprinklers, detection, suppression)
Fire-rated doors, windows, and penetrations
Fire curtains and smoke control systems
Structural fire protection (steel/concrete coatings)



Our Experience

150+ fire protection packages (warehouses, data centers, high-rise)
Compliance with AS 1530.4, BS 476, EN 13501, Polish regulations
Worked with Trafalgar, Hilti, Nullifire, FireMaster, Rockwool, Titan systems
Understand certification requirements: 3rd party testing, BCA/NCC compliance
Know labor complexity: confined spaces, sequential installation, coordination



Typical Package Scope

Fire strategy review and compartmentation schedule
Material specifications with fire ratings (FRL 60/60/60, 90/90/90, etc.)
Installation labor with access/coordination factors
Testing and commissioning (smoke tests, pressure tests)
Authority approvals and certification documentation



Critical Knowledge


Fire ratings â‰  installation costs
Penetration sealing: per penetration (not per square meter)
Intumescent coatings: surface prep = 40% of total cost
Testing & certification: can be 5-8% of package value
Coordination with other trades: critical for sequencing


Deliverable: Fire protection cost estimate with compliance roadmap



Facades & Cladding

What We Cover

Rainscreen cladding systems (terracotta, fiber cement, metal panels)
Curtain wall systems (unitized, stick-built)
Insulated panels (PIR, mineral wool, sandwich panels)
Facade access systems (BMU, gantries, cradles)
Weatherproofing and sealant systems



Our Experience

120+ facade projects (warehouses, offices, high-rise residential)
Material systems: Kingspan, Trespa, Equitone, Alucobond, Cemintel
Understanding wind loading calculations and structural integration
Complex installation sequences: scaffolding, craneage, weather delays
Know material cost volatility: metal panels = 15-25% price fluctuation risk



Typical Package Scope

Facade BOQ by elevation and system type
Substructure (rails, brackets, fixings) fully detailed
Labor by height zone
Access equipment (scaffolding, BMU hire, safety systems)
Testing (water penetration, air tightness, thermal performance)



Critical Knowledge


Facade = 15-25% of building cost but 40% of tender risks
Installation speed: 8-15 sqm/day depending on system complexity
Weather delays: factor 10-20% contingency time
Sealant replacement: budget 2-5% total for remedial works
Access equipment: can be 15-20% of installation cost


Deliverable: Facade cost estimate with installation methodology



Structural Works

What We Cover

Structural steel (frames, trusses, bracing)
Reinforced concrete (suspended slabs, columns, cores)
Post-tensioned slabs and beams
FRP (fiber-reinforced polymer) strengthening
Structural connections and tolerances



Our Experience

180+ structural packages (warehouses, bridges, high-rise, houses)
Steel: fabrication + erection + painting + fire protection
Concrete: formwork + reinforcement + pour + cure + finish
Complex calculations: load paths, connection detailing, construction sequences
Material pricing: rebar = commodity risk, structural steel = fabrication lead times



Typical Package Scope

Structural steel schedule (tonnage, connection types, erection sequence)
Concrete schedule (volumes, reinforcement density, formwork complexity)
Testing requirements (NDT, load testing, concrete strength)
Temporary works (propping, scaffolding, safety systems)
Coordination with MEP and architectural trades



Critical Knowledge


Structural steel: fabrication 40%, erection 35%, painting/fire 25%
Post-tensioned slabs: 15-20% more material cost but 30% faster construction

Duration: 2-4 days

Step 3: Installation Labor Analysis

Duration: 1 day

Deliverable: Complete specialist estimate with risk register

title: Specialist Trade Estimating: Drylining, Fire Protection, Facades, Structural | BIM Takeoff
text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: What makes specialist trade estimating different from general estimating?


A: Specialist estimators have hands-on installation experience and understand the nuances that affect costs: fire-rated systems require specific installation sequences, facade work is weather-dependent, and structural connections have hidden complexity. We account for factors that generic estimators often miss, resulting in Â±3-5% accuracy versus Â±15-20% for general estimates.




Q: Do you work with specific material systems only?


A: No.Â We have experience with all major systems (Knauf, Gyproc, Siniat, Kingspan, Trespa, Hilti, etc.) and can estimate any manufacturerâ€™s products. Our expertise is in understanding the installation and performance characteristics, not brand loyalty. We often provide value engineering alternatives using different systems.




Q: Can you estimate supply-only packages?


A: Yes. We provide estimates for supply-only, install-only, or complete supply & install packages. Each requires different considerations for waste factors, logistics, and risk allocation. Supply-only typically includes 5-8% waste, while install packages factor 10-15% waste depending on complexity.




Q: How do you handle compliance requirements?


A: We budget for all testing, certification, and approval costs from the start. This includes fire ratings (AS 1530.4, BS 476, EN 13501), structural load testing, facade performance testing, and authority approvals. These costs, often 3-8% of package value, are frequently missed in generic estimates.




Q: What information do you need to provide an estimate?


A: Ideally: architectural drawings, specifications, material preferences, and any performance requirements (fire ratings, acoustic performance, wind loads). For complex projects, we may request structural drawings and coordination plans. We can work with preliminary information and refine as details become available.




Q: Do you provide value engineering alternatives?


A: Absolutely. Every specialist estimate includes value engineering recommendations: alternative material systems, installation methods, and performance-equivalent substitutions that can reduce costs without compromising quality. Typical savings opportunities range from 10-20% of package value.




Q: What project sizes do you handle?


A: We work on projects from small fit-outs (500 sqm) to large-scale developments (50,000+ sqm). Specialist trade complexity matters more than overall project sizeâ€”a high-rise facade is more complex than a large warehouse drylining package. Minimum fee applies for projects under â‚¬500,000.




Q: Do you support tendering processes?


A: Yes. We provide full tender support: quantity take-off, detailed cost breakdown, risk analysis, bid document preparation, and contractor evaluation. Our estimates give you confidence in your tender submissions. We can also attend tender interviews and negotiations.




Q: How quickly can you provide an estimate?


A: Standard timeline is 2-3 weeks for comprehensive specialist estimates. For urgent requirements, we offer fast-track service (5-7 working days) with a 30% surcharge. Initial budget estimates can be provided within 48 hours for feasibility studies.




Q: Do you work internationally?


A: Yes. While based in Poland, we have extensive experience with EU, UK, and Australian standards. Weâ€™ve completed projects across Europe, Asia-Pacific, and the Middle East. Our estimates include location factors for labor and material costs.

text:
Frequently Asked Questions



Q: How quickly can you get our project set up?


A: Setup takes 3-5 days. We need your baseline budget, cost coding structure, and access to contract documents. If you have a 5D BIM model, we can import that directly. Without BIM, setup may take 5-7 days. Our fastest deployment was 48 hours for an urgent project.




Q: What information do you need from us each week?


A: We need progress data (quantities installed), actual costs (invoices/timesheets), and any change orders or variations. Most clients provide this via a simple Excel template we supply. Data submission typically takes your team 2-3 hours per week. We can also integrate directly with your project management software.




Q: Can you work with projects already in progress?


A: Absolutely! We specialize in taking over cost control mid-project. Weâ€™ll reconcile all historical data, verify the baseline, and have you up and running within one week. This is particularly valuable when existing cost control has fallen behind or when changing project circumstances require more rigorous oversight.




Q: How do you handle contractor payment applications?


A: We review and verify contractor payment applications against actual progress. Our service includes cross-checking claimed quantities, verifying rates, ensuring proper valuations, and providing certified recommendations for payment. This protects you from overpayment and ensures you only pay for work properly executed.




Q: What happens if we identify a potential cost overrun?


A: We immediately flag the issue in our report with Red status, quantify the potential impact, identify the root cause, and provide recommended mitigation strategies. This might include value engineering alternatives, scope adjustments, phased approaches, or enhanced procurement strategies. Our goal is to provide actionable solutions, not just report problems.




Q: Do you integrate with our existing cost management software?


A: Yes, we can integrate with most major platforms including Procore, BIM 360, Oracle Primavera, MS Project, and various accounting systems. We export data in formats compatible with your systems. If direct API integration is needed, we can arrange that for Premium tier clients.




Q: What size projects do you typically work with?


A: We handle projects from Â£2M to Â£200M+. Smaller projects typically use our Essential tier with bi-weekly reporting. Mid-sized projects (Â£5M-Â£50M) work best with Professional tier weekly reporting. Large complex projects benefit from our Premium tier with dedicated management and real-time tracking.




Q: Can you help with value engineering during construction?


A: Yes! Our ongoing cost monitoring identifies opportunities for value engineering as the project progresses. We can quickly analyze alternative materials, methods, or sequencing that could reduce costs without compromising quality. This is included in Professional and Premium tiers.




Q: How do you charge for your services?


A: Pricing varies by service tier and project size. Essential tier starts from Â£2,500/month, Professional from Â£5,000/month, and Premium from Â£10,000/month. We also offer fixed-fee arrangements for the entire construction period with discounts for longer engagements (12+ months). Contact us for a custom quote based on your project specifics.
